If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"initialize()":{"details":"Initialize the contract"},"initialize(address)":{"params":{"_token":"The token to be staked"}},"proxiableUUID()":{"details":"Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier."},"registerDomain(uint256,address[])":{"params":{"custodians":"Array of custodian addresses for this domain","epochDuration":"Duration of each epoch for this domain"}},"removeAddressFromWhitelist(address)":{"params":{"addr":"The address to remove"}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"reward(address[],uint256[],address[])":{"details":"Could be used to automatically add to attesters' stake with a restake policy","params":{"amounts":"Array of reward amounts","attesters":"Array of attester addresses","custodians":"Array of custodian addresses"}},"slash(address[],address[],uint256[],uint256[])":{"params":{"amounts":"Array of amounts to slash","attesters":"Array of attester addresses","custodians":"Array of custodian addresses","refundAmounts":"Array of refund amounts"}},"stake(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount to stake","custodian":"The custodian token contract","domain":"The domain to stake for"}},"stakeFor(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount to stake","custodian":"The custodian token contract","user":"The user to stake for"}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"unstake(address,address,uint256)":{"details":"This doesn't actually unstake immediately, but marks tokens for unstaking in the next epoch","params":{"amount":"The amount to unstake","custodian":"The custodian address","domain":"The domain to unstake from"}},"unstakeFor(address,address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount to unstake","custodian":"The custodian address","user":"The user to unstake for"}},"upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes)":{"custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow-reachable":"delegatecall","details":"Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. acceptGenesisCeremony().details: Rolls over from genesis (epoch 0) to current epoch and sets initial stakes

getCustodiansByDomain(address).details: TODO: Consider improving the API to allow domains to interpret custodians as they see fit

returns._0: uint256 Current epoch based on block time
uint256 Next epoch by block time

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

returns._0: uint256 Total stake for current epoch
uint256 Total stake for the epoch

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

params.custodians: Array of custodian addresses for this domain
params.epochDuration: Duration of each epoch for this domain

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

reward(address[],uint256[],address[]).details: Could be used to automatically add to attesters' stake with a restake policy

unstake(address,address,uint256).details: This doesn't actually unstake immediately, but marks tokens for unstaking in the next epoch

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

WHITELIST_ROLE().notice: Role required for staking and unstaking operations

acceptGenesisCeremony().notice: Accepts the genesis ceremony for a domain

currentEpochByDomain(address).notice: Mapping of domain to current epoch

domainGenesisAccepted(address).notice: Tracks which domains have accepted genesis ceremony

epochDurationByDomain(address).notice: Mapping of domain to epoch duration

epochStakesByDomain(address,uint256,addr.notice: Records of stake by address per epoch for each domain and custodian

epochTotalStakeByDomain(address,uint256,.notice: Total stake for an epoch, computed at rollover time

epochUnstakesByDomain(address,uint256,ad.notice: Records of unstake requests by address per epoch for each domain and custodian

getAttestersByDomain(address).notice: Gets all attesters for a specific domain

getCurrentEpoch(address).notice: Gets the current epoch up to which blocks have been accepted

getCurrentEpochStake(address,address,add.notice: Gets the stake for a given attester at the current epoch

getCurrentEpochUnstake(address,address,a.notice: Gets the unstake amount for a given attester at the current epoch

getCustodiansByDomain(address).notice: Gets all custodians for a specific domain

getEpochByBlockTime(address).notice: Gets the epoch for the current block time

getNextEpochByBlockTime(address).notice: Gets the next epoch based on block time

getStakeAtEpoch(address,uint256,address,.notice: Gets the stake for a given attester at a specific epoch

getTotalStakeForCurrentEpoch(address,add.notice: Gets the total stake for the current epoch and custodian

getTotalStakeForEpoch(address,uint256,ad.notice: Gets the total stake for a given epoch and custodian

getUnstakeAtEpoch(address,uint256,addres.notice: Gets the unstake amount for a given attester at a specific epoch

registerDomain(uint256,address[]).notice: Registers a domain with the staking contract

removeAddressFromWhitelist(address).notice: Removes an address from the whitelist

rollOverEpoch().notice: Public function to roll over the current epoch

stake(address,address,uint256).notice: Stakes tokens for the next epoch

stakeFor(address,address,uint256).notice: Allows a domain to stake tokens for a user under its own domain

unstake(address,address,uint256).notice: Initiates unstaking of tokens for the next epoch

unstakeFor(address,address,uint256).notice: Allows a domain to unstake tokens for a user under its own domain

whitelistAddress(address).notice: Adds an address to the whitelist
